Package classesObjects.example3

Class Fraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • classesObjects.example3.Fraction

  • public class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
    a fraction is a number of the form num/den where num and den are integers and den cannot be zero. examples: 5/12, -7/2, 0/20

    • Method Detail

      • getNum

        public int getNum​()

      • getDen

        public int getDen​()

      • setDen

        public void setDen​(int d)
        Parameters:
        d - assign parameter (d) to instance variable (den) if d is 0, den should become 1

      • isPositive

        public boolean isPositive​()
        Returns:
        true if the object represents a positive fraction, like 5/2 or -7/-2 false otherwise (examples: 7/-3 or -12/25)

      • multiply

        public Fraction multiply​(Fraction other)
        D level
        Parameters:
        other -
        Returns:
        object representing fraction that is a result of multiplying calling object with parameter object for example: if calling object represents -3/7 and parameter object represents 12/-2 return object representing fraction -36/-14

      • getSimplifiedForm

        public Fraction getSimplifiedForm​()
        D level
        Returns:
        object representing the simplified form of the calling object. for example, if calling object represents -120/-64, return object representing the fraction 15/8 since -120 = 15*-8, and -64 = 8*-8 dividing both numerator and denominator by -8, you get 15/8
